sentence: Regarding the first point, your intuition is exactly correct and a slightly simpler discussion of this phenomenon can be found in [1].
label: concur

sentence: When the network is deep enough that the covariance matrix has reached its fixed point, the distribution of the outputs of the network will be independent of the inputs.
label: concur

sentence: At this point the network becomes untrainable.
label: concur

sentence: To reconcile this with the commonsense intuition that “deeper is better”, our answer is twofold.
label: concur

sentence: 1) As in [1] and [2] it is often possible to find configurations or architectural modifications where the covariance matrix doesn’t approach its fixed point over depths often considered in machine learning.
label: concur

sentence: When this is the case one can safely increase the depth without sacrificing accuracy.
label: concur

sentence: 2) It seems that the role of depth in performance is more subtle than standard intuition would dictate.
label: concur

sentence: For example, in [3] note that although the authors were able to train a 10k hidden layer network, they did not observe any improvement in accuracy.
label: concur

sentence: In the next version of the manuscript (both in response to your review and that of referee 1) we will add a more intuitive discussion of these results which we agree are somewhat technical.

sentence: Thank you very much for your encouraging review.
label: nonarg

sentence: > I read the paper and understand it, for the most part.
label: nonarg

sentence: The idea is to interpret some regularization techniques as a form of noisy bottleneck, where the mutual information between learned parameters and the data is limited through the injection of noise.
label: nonarg

sentence: While the paper is a pleasant read, I find difficult to access its importance and the applicability of the ideas presented beyond the analogy with the capacity computation.
label: nonarg

sentence: Perhaps other referee will have a clearer opinion.
label: nonarg

sentence: The main contribution of our paper is indeed to establish a connection between variational inference and regularization by observing that Gaussian mean field introduces an upper bound on the mutual information between data and model parameters.
label: concur

sentence: Reinterpreting mean field as point estimation in a noisy model allows us to quantify observed regularizing effects.
label: concur

sentence: We show links to existing regularization strategies and validate the usefulness for regularization in targeted experiments.
label: concur

sentence: While the focus of our present work lies on establishing links between existing directions of research, we believe that our information-theoretic perspective on regularization opens up plenty of avenues for future work, both in supervised and unsupervised learning.
label: concur

sentence: For example, we are interested in improving extraction of unsupervised representations by controlling the amount of extracted information.
label: concur

sentence: In particular, we aim to mitigate latent collapse, a problem reported for example in language generation [1] and autoregressive image generation [2], which is currently mitigated with ad-hoc strategies such as KL annealing.
label: concur

sentence: Intuitively, if all information can be stored in the model itself, there is little incentive to use a per-sample latent.
label: concur

sentence: This is also known as the information preference problem, as briefly discussed at the end of section 2.1.
label: concur

sentence: Therefore, limiting mutual information of the data with the model might offer a robust mitigation strategy.
label: concur

sentence: Additionally, we believe that the approach can lead to improved representations through disentanglement, as done by beta-VAE [3].
label: concur

sentence: Our formal connection to beta-VAE derived in Appendix C offers a promising information-theoretic perspective on their empirical results.
label: concur

sentence: More generally, we want to explore non-MAP inference on noise-injected models as this would allow for using highly expressive variational distributions while enjoying the information-theoretic guarantees of simpler approximate distributions, as motivated in section 3.3.
label: concur

sentence: Since these directions are rather orthogonal, we think that sharing our theoretical framework with the community in an independent piece of work is the most effective way of communicating our ideas.
label: concur

sentence: > I'd be interested to hear if the authors see a connection between their formalism and the one of Reference prior in Bayesian inference (Bernardo et al https://arxiv.org/pdf/0904.0156)
label: nonarg

sentence: Reference priors are opposite to our work in the sense that they maximize the amount of information data provides about the parameters, while we aim to find models to limit it.
label: concur

sentence: Also, see [4] for the relation of Fisher information to generalization.
label: concur

sentence: On releasing a structured (parsed) form of the dataset: we agree that examining performance on structured input is a very useful exploration direction, that can give insight into what effect parsing has on ease of training.

sentence: We feel, however, that there’s no single canonical choice for the structure that may be suitable for all types of networks (e.g., tree networks, graph networks, etc), or different levels of structure that aid the network to different amounts, from completely unstructured to tree-like structures that essentially determine the required order of calculation.
label: dispute

sentence: For example, in the question type of “multiple function composition”, one could have a structure that lists the functions, and also the desired composition order; or one could actually have a tree structure with the functions already embedded in the correct composition order (which we suspect would be quite easy to learn models on).

sentence: In lieu of this, we hope the released dataset source code will allow researchers to easily tailor the dataset to their specific problems and models.

sentence: The “attentional LSTM” model is just the standard encoder/decoder+attention architecture prevalent in neural machine translation as introduced in “Neural machine translation by jointly learning to align and translate” (Bahdanau et al).
label: concur

sentence: However, we confusingly used the terms “parser” instead of “encoder”, and we have fixed the description.

sentence: On running the decoding LSTM for a few steps before outputting the answer: we found that it was one of the few (relatively simple) architectural changes to the standard recurrent encoder/decoder setup that significantly helped performance (thus the performance on the standard architecture can be taken to be slightly worse than the numbers reported in the paper for the architecture with “thinking steps”), but we also realize that it is not a widespread architectural change. (Possibly the need for this is less in standard machine translation tasks.) Since your review, we have also ran experiments using the published architecture introduced in “Adaptive Computation Time for Recurrent Neural Networks” (Graves).
label: dispute

sentence: This architecture has an adaptive number of “thinking” steps at every timestep dependent on the input, learnt via gradient descent.
label: dispute

sentence: More specifically we investigated the use of this for both the recurrent encoder and decoder (replacing the single fixed number of “thinking” steps at the start of the decoder).
label: dispute

sentence: After some tuning, its test performance was still around 3% worse than the same architecture without adaptive computation time.

sentence: We think your suggestions are very meaningful. We respond to them one by one:
label: nonarg

sentence: 1. We will explain anti-aliasing in our updated paper.
label: concur

sentence: Roughly, anti-aliasing is helpful for signal reconstruction.
label: concur

sentence: However, we can’t provide a strict treatment of how anti-aliasing relates to classification.
label: concur

sentence: But we have intuitions: first, we believe reconstruction relates to classification (see our next response); second, frequency components are orthogonal.
label: concur

sentence: Aliasing means different components are mixed again.
label: concur

sentence: This may mislead the next layers for processing.
label: concur

sentence: 2. To our knowledge, researchers haven’t fully understood the whole process of image classification until now.
label: concur

sentence: Thus, we can’t provide a strict treatment of how reconstruction optimality relates to classification optimality.
label: concur

sentence: But we have intuitions and empirical evidence of their relation: convolution layers are used to transform a signal which makes it easier to be classified.
label: concur

sentence: So if we accept that the feature extracted by previous convolution layers is useful, then it is best to keep it as much as possible for the current pooling layer.
label: concur

sentence: In this way, it is reasonable to assume that reconstruction optimality is consistent with classification optimality.
label: concur

sentence: On the other hand, it is difficult to directly define classification optimality for an intermediate layer.
label: concur

sentence: Moreover, several works, such as [1] have shown that using self reconstruction loss as an auxiliary is helpful for classification.
label: concur

sentence: You have raised an interesting question about how the accuracy of the GAN impacts the accuracy of the proposed method.

sentence: In order to address this, we have developed analytical estimates for the error in the point estimates computed using the proposed approach and show that these are intimately tied to error in computing the point estimates for the prior using the GAN.
label: concur

sentence: We have also demonstrated that as the generator and the discriminator of the GAN become more expressive this error tends to zero, and the exact point estimates, for both the prior and the posterior, are recovered. ** In the revised manuscript, we will include this mathematical analysis in the Appendix and refer to it in the main text. **
label: concur

sentence: We note that our method of inferring the desired image from the measured image is an unsupervised method; for training we only need a set of desired images  to construct the prior.
label: concur

sentence: We are not aware of any other unsupervised learning approach for solving these types of problems with quantified uncertainty.
label: dispute

sentence: In that regard, the calculation of point-wise variance (our metric of uncertainty) is possible only using our approach, and therefore a direct comparison is not possible, since other supervised methods (explained below) cannot work in this setting where only set of desired images are available. ** We will clarify this unique aspect in the revised version of the manuscript. **
label: dispute

sentence: •	There has been some work on computing the uncertainty in an inferred image within a supervised learning framework where pairs of measured and desired images are used for training the network [1, 2].

sentence: To address your comments:
label: nonarg

sentence: 1) Thank you for pointing out that we had not defined the delta.
label: concur

sentence: Here delta is the Kronecker delta defined so that \delta_{a,b} = 1 if a = b and 0 if a != b. In the context of the variance of the multivariate normal distribution, the delta function indicates that the different neurons in each layer have zero covariance.
label: concur

sentence: We’ll add an explicit discussion of this fact to the manuscript.
label: concur

sentence: 2) Thanks for pointing this out, we’ll correct it in the next revision.
label: concur

sentence: 3) It is true that the extent to which randomized weights describe trained networks is unclear.
label: concur

sentence: However, it is true that most commonly used weight initialization schemes are random.
label: concur

sentence: For example, He initialization [1] and Xavier initialization [2] strategies are both special cases of the setup considered here.
label: concur

sentence: We therefore view our theory as a theory of neural networks at initialization.
label: concur

sentence: (There are, however, initialization schemes that are not random and that are not described by our theory).
label: concur

sentence: [1] K. He, X. Zhang, S. Ren, J. Sun. Delving deep into rectifiers: Surpassing human-level performance on imagenet classification. (http://www.cv-foundation.org/openaccess/content_iccv_2015/html/He_Delving_Deep_into_ICCV_2015_paper.html)
label: nonarg

sentence: [2] X. Glorot, Y. Bengio, Y. W. Teh, M. Titterington. Understanding the difficulty of training deep feedforward neural networks. (http://proceedings.mlr.press/v9/glorot10a.html)
label: nonarg
